qc_config.description: Quality control settings - AI reviews slides before output

global_preferences.description: General preferences applied to all slides

placement_rules.description: Rules for choosing text position based on image analysis

align.left: Use when main subject is on the right side, or empty space on left. Good for portraits facing right.
align.center: Use for centered subjects, symmetrical compositions, or balanced images. Good for landscapes.
align.right: Use when main subject is on the left side, or empty space on right. Good for portraits facing left.

anchor.top: Use when lower portion has detail (people, buildings, action at ground level). Keeps text above the action.
anchor.mid: Use for evenly distributed compositions or when top/bottom are equally busy. Creates centered balance.
anchor.bottom: Use when upper portion is important (sky, mountains, architecture). Places text below main subjects.

fade.top: Dark gradient from top. ALWAYS pair with anchor='top' for consistency.
fade.mid: Dark center band. ALWAYS pair with anchor='mid' for emphasis.
fade.bottom: Dark gradient from bottom. ALWAYS pair with anchor='bottom' for consistency.
fade.none: No background overlay. Only use for very simple, low-detail, or solid-color backgrounds.

slide_type_preferences.description: Preferred layouts for different slide types (optional)

cover_slide.note: COVER SLIDE (Slide 1) - The opening slide that introduces the carousel. Use the most striking image, center alignment for maximum impact, bold attention-grabbing title

opening_slide.note: First content slide (Slide 2 if cover exists) - bold centered statement

portrait_photo.note: For photos with people - keep text away from faces

landscape_photo.note: For scenic photos - text at bottom to preserve sky/scenery

action_shot.note: For sports/movement - text opposite the action direction

custom_rules.description: Add your own custom rules here
examples: Never use center alignment for slides 2-4 (only first and last)
Always use bottom anchor for slides with sky
Prefer right alignment for slides with text-heavy content
Use fade='none' sparingly - only when background is very simple
your_rules: CRITICAL: Text must NEVER cover faces, heads, or upper bodies of people
For photos with people: ALWAYS use anchor='bottom' to keep text below subjects
For portraits/close-ups: Text must be in bottom 25% of image only
ALWAYS use fade gradient (top/mid/bottom) - NEVER use fade='none'
Prefer anchor='bottom' as default unless image has important ground-level detail
For action shots: Place text opposite to the direction of movement
Text must fit within margins - reduce text length if needed to prevent overflow

rules: NEVER use fade='none' - always use gradient backgrounds
NEVER use anchor='top' or anchor='mid' for photos with people/faces
NEVER place text in the upper 50% of images containing people
For portrait orientation subjects: ONLY use anchor='bottom'
Text length must not exceed image width - wrap or shorten text
